ocr_text: POLYTECHNIC UNIVERSITY OF THE PHILIPPINES COLLEGE OF BUSINESS Office of the Dean Sta. Mesa, Manila office of the dean universy edu ph (03) 8516 1865 PRACTICUM AGREEMENT FOR TEACHER EDUCATION PROGRAM. Date: February 20, 2025 TO WHOM IT MAY CONCERN: ‘This Practicum Agreementis entered into between POLYTECHNIC UNIVERSITY OF THE PHILIPPINES, COLLEGE OF BUSINESS, hereinafter referred to as the "UNIVERSITY," and the cooperating school nstitution, hereinafter referred to as the "PRACTICUM VENUE.” WHEREAS, the UNIVERSITY requires student teachers to complete supervised teaching practice as part of their professional education requirements, WHEREAS, the PRACTICUM VENUE agrees to provide opportunities for student teachers to observe, assist, and conduct actual classroom instruction; NOW, THEREFORE, the parties mutually agree as follows: PURPOSE AND OBJECTIVES 1. Provide student teachers with authentic classroom experience 2. Develop teaching competencies and professional skills 3. Apply educational theories and methodologies in actual settings 4. Foster professional relationships between pre service and in service teachers UNIVERSITY RESPONSIBILITIES 1. Assign qualified student teachers who have completed prerequisite courses 2. Provide orientation on practicum policies, procedures, and expectations 3. Assign university supervisor to conduct regular observation and evaluation 4. Ensure student teachers are covered by accident insurance 5. Coordinate schedules and requirements with the PRACTICUM VENUE 6. Address concerns and issues that may arise during practicum period lll PRACTICUM VENUE RESPONSIBILITIES 1. Assign cooperating teacher to guide and mentor student teachers 2 Allow student teachers to observe classes and teaching methodologies 3. Provide opportunities for student teachers to conduct demonstration teaching 4. Evaluate student teacher performance using university evaluation forms 5. Provide feedback and recommendations for improvement 6. Issue certificate of completion after successful practicum period IV. STUDENT TEACHER RESPONSIBILITIES 1. Observe professional conduct and dress code at all times 2. Comply with PRACTICUM VENUE policies and regulations 3. Prepare comprehensive lesson plans and instructional materials 4. Demonstrate teaching competencies across various learning areas 5. Maintain confidentiality of student records and information 6. Participate in school activities and professional development programs \V. DURATION AND SCHEDULE The practicum period shall run for 7 weeks during Second Semester of Academic Year 2025 2025. Schedule shall be coordinated between both parties. VI EVALUATION AND GRADING Student teachers shall be evaluated based on lesson planning, instructional delivery, classroom management, assessment skills, and professional qualities. Final grades shall be determined by the university ‘supervisor in consultation with the cooperating teacher. Prepared by: Office of the Dean POLYTECHNIC UNIVERSITY OF THE PHILIPPINES

ocr_text: ATENEO DE MANILA UNIVERSITY SCHOOL OF MANAGEMENT Office of the Dean Loyola Heights, Quezon City office. the dean universy edu ph (63) 4 161 5300 PAYMENT AGREEMENT FOR TUITION AND FEES Date: October 06, 2025 TO WHOM IT MAY CONCERN: This Payment Agreement is executed between ATENEO DE MANILA UNIVERSITY, SCHOOL OF MANAGEMENT, hereinafter referred to as the "UNIVERSITY," and the undersigned student parent guardian, hereinafter referred to as the "DEBTOR." WHEREAS, the DEBTOR has incurred financial obligations to the UNIVERSITY for tuition fees, laboratory fees, and other school charges for the Academic Year 2025 2025; WHEREAS, the DEBTOR acknowledges the outstanding balance and commits to settle said obligation according to terms specified herein; NOW, THEREFORE, the parties agree to the following payment terms and conditions: AMOUNT OWED The DEBTOR acknowledges an outstanding balance of PHP 25 095 00 representing tuition and other fees for the current academic period. Il PAYMENT SCHEDULE The DEBTOR agrees to settle the outstanding balance according to the following installment plan: Initial payment: 30% of total balance due upon signing Second installment: 35% of total balance due on or before midterm period Final installment: 35% of total balance due on or before final examination period Ill. LATE PAYMENT PENALTY Failure to remit payment on scheduled dates shall incur a penalty charge of 2% per month on the unpaid balance. The UNIVERSITY reserves the right to impose additional sanctions as stated in the Student Handbook IV. CONSEQUENCES OF NON PAYMENT Non compliance with this payment agreement may result in: 1 Withholding of grades and academic records 2. Non issuance of certificate of enrollment for succeeding terms 3, Exclusion from examination privileges 4. Non release of diploma and Transcript of Records 5. Legal action to recover outstanding amounts V. ACADEMIC PRIVILEGES Subject to compliance with this agreement, the DEBTOR shall retain the following privileges: Attendance in enrolled classes Access to university facilities and services Participation in academic activities and examinations Library and laboratory privileges VI. GENERAL PROVISIONS The DEBTOR agrees to promptly notify the University Accounting Office of any change in contact information or financial circumstances. This agreement shall be governed by university policies and Philippine laws. Issued by: Office of the Dean ATENEO DE MANILA UNIVERSITY

ocr_text: POLYTECHNIC UNIVERSITY OF THE PHILIPPINES COLLEGE OF BUSINESS. Office ofthe Dean Sta. Mesa, Manila offceof the dean universiy edu ph (93 7 2762612 MEMORANDUM OF AGREEMENT. FOR INTERNSHIP PROGRAM Date: August 23, 2025 TO WHOM IT MAY CONCERN: This Memorandum of Agreement is entered into on this day between POLYTECHNIC UNIVERSITY OF THE PHILIPPINES, COLLEGE OF BUSINESS, hereinafter referred to as the "UNIVERSITY," and the participating industry partner, hereinafter referred to as the "HOST COMPANY.” WHEREAS, the UNIVERSITY offers academic programs that require students to undergo practical training and on the job experience as part of their degree requirements: WHEREAS, the HOST COMPANY agrees to provide intemship opportunities to qualified students of the UNIVERSITY to enhance their professional skills and competencies NOW, THEREFORE, in consideration of the mutual covenants and agreements contained herein, the parties agree as follows: |. OBJECTIVES 1. To provide students with practical work experience relevant to their field of study 2. To enhance students’ technical skills and professional competencies 3. To establish industry academe linkages for mutual benefit 4. To facilitate knowledge transfer between academic institutions and industry partners Il RESPONSIBILITIES OF THE UNIVERSITY 1. Screen and endorse qualified students to the HOST COMPANY 2. Assign faculty supervisor to monitor student progress 3. Provide necessary academic guidance and support to student interns 4. Ensure students comply with HOST COMPANY policies and regulations 5, Process required documentation and insurance coverage for student intems Ill. RESPONSIBILITIES OF THE HOST COMPANY 1. Provide meaningful work assignments aligned with students’ academic programs 2. Assign workplace supervisor to guide and evaluate student performance 3. Provide safe working environment and necessary equipment 4. Issue certificate of completion upon successful intemship period 5. Provide feedback on student performance to university supervisor IV. DURATION This agreement shall be effective for a period of one (1) year from the date of signing and may be renewed upon mutual agreement of both parties. \V. GENERAL PROVISIONS Both parties agree to comply with all applicable laws, rules, and regulations. Any disputes shall be resolved through amicable settlement. Either party may terminate this agreement with sixty (60) days prior written notice. Prepared by: Office of the Dean POLYTECHNIC UNIVERSITY OF THE PHILIPPINES

Office of he Dean Taft Avenue, Manila ‘oftce of he deangunwersty ou om (+03) 5208 0732 MEMORANDUM OF AGREEMENT FOR INTERNSHIP PROGRAM Date: December 10, 2024 TO WHOM IT MAY CONCERN: This Memorandum of Agreement is entered into on this day between DE LA SALLE UNIVERSITY, COLLEGE OF COMPUTER STUDIES, hereinafter referred to as the “UNIVERSITY.” and the participating industry partner, hereinafter referred to as the HOST COMPANY WHEREAS, the UNIVERSITY offers academic programs that require students to undergo practical training and on the job experience as part of their degree requirements; WHEREAS, the HOST COMPANY agrees to provide intership opportunities to qualified students of the UNIVERSITY to enhance their professional skills and competencies; NOW, THEREFORE, in consideration of the mutual covenants and agreements contained herein, the parties agree as follows |. OBJECTIVES 1. To provide students with practical work experience relevant to their field of study 2. To enhance students’ technical skills and professional competencies 3. To establish industry academe linkages for ‘mutual benefit 4. To facilitate knowledge transfer between academic institutions and industry partners Il, RESPONSIBILITIES OF THE UNIVERSITY 1. Screen and endorse qualified students to the HOST COMPANY 2. Assign faculty supervisor to monitor student progress 3. Provide necessary academic guidance ‘and support to student intems 4. Ensure students comply with HOST COMPANY policies and regulations 5. Process required documentation and insurance coverage for student intems Ml, RESPONSIBILITIES OF THE HOST COMPANY 1. Provide meaningful work assignments aligned with internship period 5. Provide feedback on student performance to university supervisor IV. DURATION This agreement shall be effective for a period of one (1) year from the date of signing and may be renewed upon mutual agreement of both parties. V. GENERAL PROVISIONS Both parties agree to comply with all applicable laws, rules, and reguiations. Any disputes shall be resolved through amicable settlement. Either party may terminate this agreement with sixty (60) days prior written notice. Prepared by: Office of the Dean DE LA SALLE UNIVERSITY

OBJECTIVES 1. To provide students with practical work experience relevant to their field of study 2. To enhance students’ technical skills and professional competencies 3. To establish industry academe linkages for mutual benefit 4. To facilitate knowledge transfer between academic institutions and industry partners Il RESPONSIBILITIES OF THE UNIVERSITY 1. Screen and endorse qualified students to the HOST COMPANY 2. Assign faculty supervisor to monitor student progress 3. Provide necessary academic guidance and support to student interns 4. Ensure students comply with HOST COMPANY policies and regulations 5. Process required documentation and insurance coverage for student intems Ill. RESPONSIBILITIES OF THE HOST COMPANY 1. Provide meaningful work assignments aligned with students’ academic programs 2. Assign workplace supervisor to guide and evaluate student performance 3. Provide safe working environment and necessary equipment 4. Issue certificate of completion upon successful intemship period 5. Provide feedback on student performance to university supervisor IV. DURATION This agreement shall be effective for a period of one (1) year from the date of signing and may be renewed upon mutual agreement of both parties. V. GENERAL PROVISIONS Both parties agree to comply with all applicable laws, rules, and regulations. Any disputes shall be resolved through amicable settlement. Either party may terminate this agreement with sixty (60) days prior written notice. Prepared by: Office of the Dean DE LA SALLE UNIVERSITY
